title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 13 april [1867]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 13 April [1867]
text: 13 April 1867April 13thMy dear Waltit is saturdaySaturday afternoon and martha is gone away and hattie and julia levy has gone to take a walk and california and Eddy is the only company i have at present and there seemesseemes to be A lull in the confusion so I thought I would take the chance to write A few lines to say I received your letter on wensdayWednesday and the money all safe so on the strenghtstrength of the 5 dollars I went down town for the first time sincsince I have been up here I felt quite strange george gave me A great charge to be carefullcareful I thought I should go and see aunt becca but it got so late I didentdidn't go while I was waiting for the car who should I see but georgee he had been to court he was suppeaned—subpoenaed— something about some work that the parties couldentcouldn't agree so he put me in the car and i was glad to get out of the bustle I have lived in the country so long it seemed quite strange i suppose Walt you have got my letter Jeff was gone away and i sent it by davis if you have not got it the 10 dollar came all safe and the envelopesenvelopes you will be home wontwon't you Walt in July you must try tooto come as soon as that if you can) george talks about our house quite strong and you may depend i dontdon't looselose an opportunatyopportunity to put in a few words in favor of it carpenters gets 4 dodollars per day and plasterers 6 dosdollars wonderfullwonderful wages aintain't it i must stop writing as Edd is waiting to take the letter i am about the same some days i dontdon't feel very well then again i feel quite spry my wrist keeps lame yet good bie Walter dear Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 13 April [1867]
